                        "For example, my.AppName, file://my/app.yaml, or classpath://my/AppName.groovy -- "

                        + "load classes from other locations")

persist

@Option(name = { "--persist" }, allowedValues = { "disabled", "auto", "rebind", "clean" },
                title = "persistance mode",
                description =
                        "The persistence mode. Possible values are: \n"+
                        "disabled: will not read or persist any state; \n"+
                        "auto: will rebind to any existing state, or start up fresh if no state; \n"+
                        "rebind: will rebind to the existing state, or fail if no state available; \n"+
                        "clean: will start up fresh (not using any existing state)")
public java.lang.String persist

public java.lang.String persistenceDir

stopOnKeyPress

@Beta
@Option(name = { "-sk", "--stopOnKeyPress" },
                description = "After the application gets started, brooklyn will wait for a key press to stop it.")
public boolean stopOnKeyPress
Note that this is a temporary workaround to allow for running the brooklyn-whirr example. This will be replaced by more powerful CLI control for running processes, to send shutdown and other commands to brooklyn. Without using this flag you get a java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException because the brooklyn and whirr shutdown hooks get executed in parallel. This is how it looks like: {
linktourl:
https://gist.github.com/47066f72d6f6f79b953e}

Helper method that gets an instance of a brooklyn AbstractApplication or an ApplicationBuilder. Guaranteed to be non-null result of one of those types (throwing exception if app not appropriate).
